Creative fashion designer with background in the catagories of swim, intimate apparel, loungewear, and sportswear.
Experience designing wovens and cut and sew knits, creating technical drawings and packages.
Excellent time management, organizational skills, and work ethic.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Electrical Engineer

Location: Tulsa, OK

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Description

Who We Are:

Integrated Power Services (IPS) is the leading North American solution provider for power management, electro-mechanical and rotating assets. Serving customers across a wide range of industries, including power generation, utilities, water and wastewater, petrochemicals, air separation, oil & gas, metals, mining, paper, aggregates, and cement.

IPS defines world-class electric motor and generator repair, and Power Management every day. When you work for IPS, you can learn from industry experts and discover your potential while being part of a winning team committed to upholding our core values: Safety, Integrity, Teamwork, Accountability, Customer Focus, and Entrepreneurial Spirit.

Principal Responsibilities And Expectations

Integrated Power Services (IPS) is seeking an Electrical Engineer to support the Central Region from the IPS Tulsa Service Center. This position will provide technical leadership and functional support focused on achieving IPS Annual Operating Plan growth and operating objectives. This position will also develop and deploy technologies that advance the strategic vision and mission of IPS, and establish uniform specifications and work standards for electric motor in-shop repair and field service functions.

Test and monitor electric motor operational performanceTroubleshoot motor performance issues and failures in-shop and on-sitePerform RCFA on failed motorsDrive the development of electrical work on repair instructions and reverse engineer motor designsLead and participate in redesign projects for various motor typesProvide Electrical technical support to customers, repair shops, and field service activitiesReview and approve coil designs and insulation systemsEnsure that repairs meet customer expectations and applicable industry standardsLead and assist on potential warranty investigations for repair and field serviceEnsure compliance with regulatory standards as specified for NEMA-MG1, IEEE, ASME, ASTM, MSHA, 10CFR-50 Appendix B, UL and CSA Interpret and ensure compliance with operating policies and proceduresSupervise both in process and final acceptance tests to confirm compliance with IPS/customer specificationsAssist with failure and repair reports on motors Assist with the implementation of quality improvement actionsActively participate in the IPS UCE tier meeting processUtilize Continuous Improvement Process Solution (CIPS) tools and Processes

Qualifications And Competencies

10 years experience with AC Motors and/or GeneratorsKnowledge of AC & DC insulation systems, coil design- Volts/Turn, Volts/Mil CalculationsKnowledge of High Voltage MotorsKnowledge of Stator and Rotor Core-Loss Testing, AC and DC Hipot Testing, and Surge Comparison TestingWorking Knowledge IEEE Standards: IEEE-101, IEEE-43- IEEE -95, IEEE- 286, IEEE-522, IEEE-1043, IEEE-1553, IEEE-1434, IEEE-1068,Hands on knowledge of troubleshooting AC & DC motor issuesWorking knowledge of flux calculations for AC Induction MotorsProficient with Computer Aided Design programsMust be able and willing to travel up to 1-2 weeks per month

Benefits

 Paid Time Off (PTO) 401k Employer Match Bonus Incentives Tuition Reimbursement Program Medical, Dental and Vision plans Employee Assistance Program (EAP) And more!

IPS is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.

Any offer of employment is contingent upon the successful completion of a background investigation. As a federal contractor, our company is committed to maintaining a safe and drug-free workplace. Candidates for this position are required to complete a pre-employment drug screen successfully. The drug screening process will include testing for substances that may impair one's ability to perform the job safely and effectively.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
